intro: Schoenocrambe barnebyi, commonly known as the Barneby's bladderpod, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, lobed leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
